availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theodrie J. Macey (Versailles, Kentucky, farmer, horse trainer, and soldier)

body.p: Versailles, Kentucky, farmer, horse trainer, and soldier. Franklin County, Kentucky native. Married to Sally F. Macey. Father of Robert W. Macey, Fannie B. Macey, Kate Macey, Gus Macey, Rebecca Macey, and Emma Macey. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Horse trainer in Versailles in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Versailles in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from July 31, 1862 to August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 3A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 7.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 5.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 97.
